00153 // On Mac OS X, it's better not to use the wxThread class.
00154 // We use our own implementation based on pthreads instead.
00155 
00156 class ODManagerHelperThread {
00157  public:
00158    typedef int ExitCode;
00159    ODManagerHelperThread() { mDestroy = false; mThread = NULL; }
00160   /* ExitCode*/ void Entry(){
00161          ODManager::Instance()->Start();
00162    }
00163 
00164    void Create() {}
00165    void Delete() {
00166       mDestroy = true;
00167       pthread_join(mThread, NULL);
00168    }
00169    bool TestDestroy() { return mDestroy; }
00170    void Sleep(int ms) {
00171       struct timespec spec;
00172       spec.tv_sec = 0;
00173       spec.tv_nsec = ms * 1000 * 1000;
00174       nanosleep(&spec, NULL);
00175    }
00176    static void *callback(void *p) {
00177       ODManagerHelperThread *th = (ODManagerHelperThread *)p;
00178       /* return (void *) */th->Entry();
00179    }
00180    
00183    void SetPriority(int priority)
00184    {
00185       mPriority=priority;
00186    }
00187    
00188    void Run() {
00189       pthread_create(&mThread, NULL, callback, this);
00190    }
00191  private:
00192    bool mDestroy;
00193    pthread_t mThread;
00194    
00195    int mPriority;
00196 
00197 };
00198 
00199 #else
00200 
00201    class ODManagerHelperThread : public wxThread  
00202    {
00203       public:
00206       ODManagerHelperThread(): wxThread(){}
00207    
00208       protected:
00210       void *Entry()
00211       {
00212          ODManager::Instance()->Start();
00213          return NULL;
00214       }
00215      
00216    };
